purpose: Computes the combinatorial upper bound on how many unique names a naming domain can generate, given its phonology and syllable range
Checks whether generated names within a domain are distinct enough from one another by measuring nearest-neighbor distances and returning a pass/fail report
Groups names that are too similar to each other into clusters using a distance threshold, exposing problematic near-duplicate sets
Samples a domain and returns statistics about name variety including unique starts, unique endings, average similarity, and detected clusters
Tests whether names generated from different naming domains are distinguishable from one another using shape-based classification and centroid distance
Converts a single name string into a structured feature vector capturing length, syllable count, vowel ratio, bigram frequencies, and character ending for ML-based analysis
Approximates the number of syllables in a name by counting vowel groups
Returns the proportion of vowel characters to the total length of a name
Returns the number of apostrophe characters present in a name
Returns the number of hyphen characters present in a name
Extracts all two-character sequences from a name and returns their frequency counts as a Map
Returns the last two characters of a name in lowercase, used as a phonetic ending signature
Flattens a structured name feature vector into a numeric array aligned to a shared vocabulary of bigrams and endings, for use in distance and classification algorithms
Collects the full set of bigrams and endings present across a collection of feature vectors to form a shared vocabulary for vectorization
Computes the mean numeric feature vector (centroid) for a collection of name feature vectors
Rescales a set of numeric feature arrays to the [0, 1] range per dimension, returning the normalized arrays along with the per-dimension min and max
Computes the minimum edit distance between two strings using the standard dynamic-programming Levenshtein algorithm
Returns the Levenshtein distance between two strings scaled to [0, 1] by dividing by the longer string's length

Measures the structural phonetic distance between two names by computing normalized Levenshtein distance on their shape keys
Builds an N×N distance matrix for a list of names by applying a given distance function to every pair
Finds the closest other name for each name in a list, returning the neighbor and its distance
Computes summary statistics (min, p1, p5, median, p95, p99, max, mean) over a list of numeric distance values
Computes the Euclidean distance between two equal-length numeric feature vectors
Computes the cosine similarity between two equal-length numeric feature vectors, returning a value in [0, 1]
